DOC.brief_title: Randomised Ischaemic Mitral Evaluation ( RIME ) Trial
DOC.detailed_description: 70 patient moderate functional ischaemic MR undergo CABG recruit . Patients randomise undergo either CABG alone CABG combine mitral annuloplasty . Patients investigated baseline , 3 month 1 year surgery determine functional capacity , quality life , cardiac function .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients undergo CABG . 2 . Patients moderate functional ischaemic mitral regurgitation without leaflet prolapse . 1 . Patients severe LV dysfunction ( EF less 30 % ) . 2 . Patients associated significant aortic valve disease . 3 . Patients significant comorbidities : renal impairment ( creatinine > 160 ) , liver impairment ( INR > 2.0 , bilirubin > 40 ) , underlie chronic obstructive lung disease ( FEV1 : FVC ratio < 0.6 ) . 4 . Patients NYHA class IV symptom , unstable angina , acute pulmonary oedema cardiogenic shock . 5 . Patients unsuitable surgery e.g . patient advanced malignancy , unable give inform consent . 6 . Patients structural abnormality mitral valve e.g . papillary muscle rupture , chordal rupture , etc . 7 . Patients associated condition would significantly increase risk surgery . 8 . Patients previous cardiac surgery . 9 . Patients previous history endocarditis
